title: Another cloudburst hits Uttarakhand: 1 feared dead, widespread damage reported in Chamoli - Firstpost
article_text:
A cloudburst late Friday night caused widespread destruction in UttarakhandтАЩs Chamoli district, leaving one person feared dead and several areas, including Tharali market and the tehsil complex, badly hit.
Follow us on Google News
Subscribe
Join Us
Search and rescue operation underway following flash floods triggered by a cloudburst, at Dharali, in Uttarkashi. PTI

A cloudburst struck UttarakhandтАЩs Chamoli district late Friday night, unleashing heavy debris flow that caused widespread destruction. Tharali market, Kotdeep, and the Tharali tehsil complex were among the worst-hit areas, with mud and rubble sweeping into homes, the SDM residence, and several buildings.

Vehicles parked at the tehsil complex were buried, while streets turned into pools of water and debris. In Sagwara village, a young girl is feared dead after being trapped under the rubble, triggering panic among locals who rushed out of their homes as rescue operations got underway.

STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD

Shops in Chepdaon market also suffered damage, and one person has been reported missing, adding to the crisis.

Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed concern, saying he is in constant touch with officials monitoring relief efforts. In a post on X, he wrote, тАЬLate last night, a tragic report of a cloudburst was received in the Tharali area of Chamoli district. The district administration, SDRF, and police have reached the spot and are engaged in relief and rescue operations. In this regard, I am in constant contact with the local administration and am personally closely monitoring the situation. I pray to God for everyoneтАЩs safety.тАЭ

title: Cyclone Fengal: IMD says landfall near Puducherry started, to take 4 hours to fully cross coast - MSN
article_text:
Cyclone Fengal has started its landfall near Puducherry, with the process expected to take approximately four hours to complete, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said in its latest update.
S Balachandran, Additional Director General of the IMD-Regional Meteorological Centre, said that the landfall process began around 5:30 pm on November 30. He confirmed that the storm is making landfall near the Puducherry area and will take about four hours to fully cross the coast. He added that further updates will be provided as more information becomes available.
In a 7:35 pm update, the IMD reported that the forward sector of the cyclone's spiral bands has already moved inland. The storm is forecast to continue moving west-southwest, crossing the northern Tamil Nadu-Puducherry coast between Karaikal and Mahabalipuram, near Puducherry, with wind speeds of 70-80 km/h, gusting up to 90 km/h, over the next 3 to 4 hours.
At the time of the update, the storm was located about 40 km off the coast, 50 km south-southeast of Mahabalipuram, 60 km east-northeast of Puducherry, and 90 km south of Chennai, according to the IMD.
The India Meteorological Department predicted light to moderate rainfall or thundershowers at many places over south coastal and Rayalaseema regions while extremely heavy rains are expected at one or two places over SPSR-Nellore, Tirupati and Chittoor districts of Andhra Pradesh on Saturday.

title: Hill state тАШlakeтАЩ spits boulders after flash flood, forcing evacuations in Uttarkashi - Telegraph India
article_text:
A lake-like water body in Syanachatti that opened up after the devastating flash flood in Uttarkashi is growing in size by the hour, posing a threat to residents of over six adjoining villages.

тАЬHill water carrying mud and boulders is flowing down at great speed. This has created the water body. It was earlier limited to the banks of the Yamuna, but now its water has entered our village. Huge boulders are also flowing into houses and hotels in Syanachatti,тАЭ Navadeep Rawat, a villager, told reporters.

ADVERTISEMENT

тАЬInitially, water had accumulated in Kupda Khadd, a natural ditch, but we thought it wouldnтАЩt affect us. It started overflowing soon and took the shape of a lake on the right side of Syanachatti. A bridge on the Yamunotri Highway was also submerged after the water level rose. Tourists are stranded in several places,тАЭ he added.

The administration has started evacuating the residents of Syanachatti, Kuthanur and Kharadi villages. Some people have shifted on their own to nearby villages. Around 150 girl students from the Kasturba Gandhi School hostel near Barkot have also been shifted to Uttarkashi for a few days.

title: Heavy rains lash Chennai and surrounding areas - KWS Chennai
article_text:
Chennai and its suburbs have been pounded by heavy rain today, marking the third spell since early morning. The first downpour began around 5:00 AM, followed by evening thunderstorms at 6:00 PM, and now a widespread spell that started at 2:30 AM has drenched most parts of the city.

Several areas have already recorded 60 mm or more since 8:30 AM, with some places crossing the 100 mm mark.

Showers are expected to continue into the early hours with gradually reduced intensity. Weather conditions remain favorable for thunderstorms over Chennai and nearby regions for the next 2тАУ3 days.

title: Heavy rains lash TN; sanitation worker electrocuted in waterlogged Chennai area - The New Indian Express
article_text:
CHENNAI: Many places in Tamil Nadu including Chennai, Tiruvallur, Chengalpattu, Kancheepuram and Tiruvannamalai districts, received moderate to heavy overnight rains.
A sanitation worker who inadvertently stepped on a fallen live electric wire was electrocuted in the city early on Saturday, police said.
The sanitation worker, identified as Varalakshmi, had waded through stagnant water at Kannagi Nagar here during her early morning cleaning work, hardly noticing a severed electric wire.
She died due to electrocution, police said.
The overnight downpour caused water to stagnate in several areas in Chennai and a huge tree was uprooted near Loyola College in Nungambakkam.
City traffic police personnel and Greater Chennai Corporation workers rushed to the spot and cleared the tree branches and restored traffic in the area.
Traffic police official claimed that the subways in the city were cleared of stagnant water and urged the residents to commute safely.
The weather office has forecast moderate to severe thunderstorms over Chennai, Tiruvallur, Chengalpattu, Kanchipuram, Thiruvannamlai, Villupuram and Nagapattinam districts.
Saturday's rain is the straight second day of sharp showers in Chennai, its suburbs and other parts.

title: Flood alert in 11 districts of Tamil Nadu as inflows swell Mettur dam - MSN
article_text:
Following a significant increase in water discharge from Karnataka's reservoirs into the Mettur dam, Tamil Nadu's Water Resources Department (WRD) has issued a flood warning for 11 districts in the Cauvery delta region.
In an advisory, the WRD stated that the combined discharge from the Krishna Raja Sagar (KRS) and Kabini dams has been increased to 95,000 cusecs. Owing to this, there has been an inflow into the Mettur reservoir. Officials are of the view that the dam will soon reach its full capacity of 120 feet. Once this level is reached, the surplus water will be released into the Cauvery River. The department warned that an initial discharge of 50,000 to 70,000 cusecs is expected from Mettur, with the volume potentially increasing further based on inflows.

Godavari in spate, 2nd flood warning in force
Deekshitula Subrahmanyam
Hans News Service | 23 Aug 2025 7:25 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Rajamahendravaram: GodavariRiver is in full spate following incessant rains in the upper catchment areas, with a second flood warning issued at...

Rajamahendravaram: GodavariRiver is in full spate following incessant rains in the upper catchment areas, with a second flood warning issued at Dowleswaram Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage early Friday morning as water levels surged past the danger mark.

According to Head Works Executive Engineer G Srinivasa Rao, approximately 1.3 million cusecs of floodwater are currently being discharged into the sea, a figure expected to rise over the next 48 hours.

The water level at the barrage has shown slight fluctuations throughout the day. At 2 pm on Friday, the gauge level was recorded at 14.3 feet with a pond level of 15.03 meters. At that time, 10,800 cusecs were being released into irrigation canals, while 1,357,119 cusecs of surplus water were discharged downstream into the sea.

The situation remained stable at 4 pm, with the gauge level holding at 14.3 feet and the pond level at 15.03 meters. The discharge into canals continued at 10,800 cusecs, with surplus water at 1,357,119 cusecs.

By 6 pm, the gauge level had slightly dropped to 14.2 ft, and the pond level was at 15 meters. At this time, the release into canals was increased to 12,600 cusecs, while the surplus water discharged was 1,351,272 cusecs.

As Godavari River remains in spate, revenue and police officials have successfully relocated 294 residents from the riverтАЩs islands to the mainland. The evacuees are from Kethavari Lanka, Vedurulamma Lanka, Godavari Gattu, and Bridge Lanka.

All the flood-affected individuals have been moved to a relief camp set up at the municipal marriage hall in Alkat Gardens. Authorities also ensured that all fishing boats were brought to the shore to prevent them from being swept away.

Officials have advised the public that in case of an emergency, they can contact the control room at the Sub-CollectorтАЩs office at 0883-2442344. District Collector P. Prashanthi visited the relief camp to oversee the arrangements for the displaced residents.

Meanwhile, continuous heavy rainfall has submerged paddy seedlings in several areas of the district.

Agricultural officials have confirmed that the rain has damaged paddy crops across 390 hectares, affecting 546 farmers in 14 villages across four mandals. So far, a total of 70,300 hectares of paddy planting has been completed in the district. The official report indicates that the damage is concentrated in Rajamahendravaram Rural (230 hectares), Sitanagaram (80 hectares), Gokavaram (30 hectares), and Tallapudi (50 hectares).

title: Low pressure area formed, heavy to very heavy rain to lash Odisha - KalingaTV
article_text:
Low pressure area formed, heavy to very heavy rain to lash Odisha
A low pressure area over Gangetic West Bengal and neighbourhood has been formed, informed the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Friday.
By Subadh Nayak Last updated Aug 23, 2025
 Share

Bhubaneswar: A low pressure area over Gangetic West Bengal and neighbourhood has been formed, informed the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Friday.

Under the influence of the upper air cyclonic circulation over Gangetic West Bengal and adjoining Bangladesh a low pressure area has formed over Gangetic West Bengal and neighbourhood at 5.30 PM today, said the Meteorological Department.

The associated upper air cyclonic circulation extends upto 7.6 km above mean sea level tilting southwestwards with height. It is likely to move west northwestwards across Jharkhand during next 24 hours and weaken gradually thereafter, it added.

Meanwhile, the weather department predicted that the low pressure would trigger heavy rainfall across Odisha. Check the day-wise rain alert for the State.

Day 1 (Valid upto 8.30 AM of August 23):

title: Telkoi Hit Hard By Flash Floods After Heavy Downpour In Keonjhar - Ommcom News
article_text:
Bhubaneswar: Heavy rainfall overnight has caused flash flooding in the Keonjhar district, particularly in the Telkoi area. The incessant downpour has led to waterlogging and submerged roads, leaving several places inaccessible.
According to reports, due to torrential downpour, the Samakoi River and other streams are swollen, with water overflowing onto the roads and bridges. The situation is dire, with the incessant rainfall bringing the region to a standstill and causing significant disruptions to daily life.
The bridge over the Samakoi River near the Telkoi Dakabangala is currently submerged under three feet of water. This has disrupted traffic between Telkoi and major cities like Bhubaneswar, Cuttack, Dhenkanal, Talcher, and Keonjhar. As a result, hundreds of passengers are stranded, and over a hundred vehicles, including passenger buses, are stuck on both sides of the bridge.
The Samakoi River is overflowing near Karadangi, and floodwaters are also inundating the Pitanali bridge.
The district administration, meanwhile, is urged to take immediate action to mitigate the effects of the flooding and ensure the safety of those affected. The situation is expected to worsen, and administration is working to find solutions to restore normalcy in the region.

title: IMD issues red alert for extremely heavy rainfall over East Rajasthan - Newsonair
article_text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for extremely heavy rainfall over East Rajasthan today. The Met department has forecast heavy to very heavy rainfall at isolated places over Delhi, Haryana, Bihar, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Chandigarh, Punjab, Uttarakhand, West Madhya Pradesh, West Rajasthan and Northern region for next 2 to 3 days .

Similar conditions are predicted over Odisha, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal. IMD has also forecast thunderstorms accompanied by lightning and gusty wind today in places over Bihar, Interior Karnataka, Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Gilgit, Baltistan, Muzaffarabad, Jharkhand, Odisha, Telangana, West Bengal and Sikkim.

title: Cloudburst in UttarakhandтАЩs Chamoli District Triggers Flash Floods, 1 Dead, 1 Missing - heraldgoa.in
article_text:
A sudden cloudburst in Chamoli districtтАЩs Tharali area late Friday night triggered flash floods, claiming one life, leaving another person missing, and causing widespread destruction.
Authorities reported that debris from the cloudburst swept through the Tharali market, damaging shops, vehicles, and residential buildings. Several homes were buried under mud and rubble, and government establishments were also affected.
District Magistrate Sandeep Tiwari described the situation as severe. тАЬThere is a possibility of significant damage due to the cloudburst in Tharali tehsil last night. A lot of debris has come down, resulting in many houses, including the SDM residence, being completely damaged,тАЭ he said.
Rescue and relief operations are underway as officials assess the full extent of the damage. Residents have been urged to remain cautious amid the risk of further landslides and flooding in the area.

title: Uttarakhand: Cloudburst in Chamoli district caused widespread damage in Tharali tehsil - Newsonair
article_text:
In Uttarakhand, a cloudburst due to heavy rainfall in Chamoli district last night caused widespread damage in Tharali tehsil, with debris sweeping into residential buildings, shops, and government premises, including the Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) residence and tehsil office.

A young woman is feared trapped under the debris. Several areas, including the Tharali tehsil headquarters, Kedarbagarh, Radibagarh, and Chepado, have also been affected due to heavy rainfall. In a social media post, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said, the district administration, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) and police have reached the spot and are engaged in relief and rescue operations.

Mr Dhami said, he is in constant contact with the local administration and closely monitoring the situation. He prayed for everyoneтАЩs safety. Meanwhile, the district administration has declared a holiday for all schools and anganwadi centers up to Class 12th in Tharali tehsil. Heavy rain continues across the state. The Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert for very heavy rainfall in Dehradun, Nainital, Bageshwar, and Pithoragarh, with warnings of heavy downpours for other regions as well.

title: Cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Chamoli: Houses under debris, 2 people missing - The Economic Times
article_text:
ET Online
Heavy overnight rain in Tharali town of Chamoli district triggered flooding in a rain drain, sweeping debris into houses, markets, and government offices, officials said on Saturday.

The Tunri Gadhera, a seasonal canal that carries excess rainwater, overflowed and dumped debris into the tehsil office before merging with the Pindar River.


Two people were reported missing from nearby Sagwara and Chepdon markets. Kavita, a 20-year-old woman, went missing in Sagwara, while another person was unaccounted for in Chepdon, officials said.


Chamoli Additional District Magistrate Vivek Prakash confirmed heavy damage to buildings in Tharali and surrounding areas. Teams from the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) and police were dispatched Friday night but were delayed after a key road was blocked. Relief camps are being set up, Prakash added.



тАФ ANI (@ANI)

Chamoli District Magistrate Sandeep Tiwari left for the site early Saturday morning. The Chamoli District Disaster Management Centre said the KarnaprayagтАУGwaldam National Highway had been shut after debris piled up near Ming Gadhera. The TharaliтАУSagwara and Dungri motor roads were also blocked.


Schools in three development blocks remained closed on Saturday by government order.


Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed grief over the damage, saying in a social media post: тАЬI am closely monitoring the situation myself. I pray to God for everyoneтАЩs safety.тАЭ


The disaster comes weeks after a cloudburst in Uttarkashi district left one person dead and at least 65 missing. Flash floods then destroyed large parts of Dharali village, a key stopover on the Gangotri route, burying homes, hotels, and shops in a torrent of slush, rubble, and water.

title: Cloudburst in UttarakhandтАЩs Chamoli: Woman buried, one missing as houses, vehicles lie under debris - Moneycontrol
article_text:

A cloudburst hit UttarakhandтАЩs Chamoli district in the early hours of Saturday, bringing heavy destruction. Huge amounts of debris rushed down the slopes and slammed into several houses, leaving behind a scene of chaos in Tharali tehsil of the district.
According to a report by Hindustan Times, a woman got buried beneath the debris and a man is missing in Tharali tehsil.
тАЬA 20-year-old woman named Kavita has been buried, and a man named Joshi is missing. NDRF and SDRF teams moved to the spot last night,тАЭ said Chamoli ADM, Vivek Prakash, adding that floods have blocked roads and authorities are engaged in relief work. Vehicles parked inside the tehsil complex were also covered in rubble. The heavy flow of water and sludge turned many streets of the town into ponds, making movement difficult.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for the state. It has warned of very heavy rainfall, thunderstorms, and lightning across several districts, including Dehradun, Tehri, Pauri, Chamoli, Rudraprayag, Nainital, and Almora. The warning will remain in place until Saturday afternoon.
According to a report by India Today, Chamoli District Magistrate Dr Sandeep Tiwari reached the affected spot along with relief teams. He said that both police and administration staff are working hard to carry out rescue and relief operations. A team from the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) has also been sent from Gauchar to join the efforts. In addition, the Border Roads Organisation (BRO) is trying to clear blocked roads near Ming Khedere so that traffic and relief vehicles can move freely.
In Pithoragarh district, officials said the Thal-Munsyari and Munsyari-Milam roads had to be shut down because of landslides triggered by continuous rain. Police have asked people in rain-prone and landslide-prone areas to remain careful and avoid unnecessary travel. Just earlier this week, two people lost their lives in Uttarkashi when debris from a hillside fell onto the Gangotri Highway near Dabrani.
Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed his concern and said he was monitoring the situation very closely. In a post on X, he shared: тАЬLate last night, a tragic report of a cloudburst was received in the Tharali area of Chamoli district. The district administration, SDRF, and police have reached the spot and are engaged in relief and rescue operations. In this regard, I am in constant contact with the local administration and am personally closely monitoring the situation. I pray to God for everyone's safety.тАЭ
Meanwhile, as a safety step, the district administration has ordered all schools and anganwadi centres in Tharali tehsil to remain shut on Saturday.

title: Cloudburst causes extensive damage in Uttarakhand's Chamoli; 1 feared dead - India Today - India Today
article_text:
A cloudburst in the Tharali region of Chamoli, Uttarakhand, on Friday night has caused widespread destruction. Reports from the ground indicate one girl is trapped under debris and another person is missing. The deluge has sent a massive flow of debris through the Tharali market and tehsil, damaging homes and burying several vehicles. The State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) and other rescue teams are conducting relief operations in the affected areas, although many roads remain blocked or have been washed away. This event follows other recent cloudbursts and flash floods in the higher regions of the state. Experts have started pointing to climate change as a factor in the increasing frequency of these incidents.

title: Cloudburst Hits Uttarakhand's Chamoli: Several Feared Missing, Markets Destroyed As Roads Collapse - News18
article_text:
One Feared Dead, Several Missing As Cloudburst Hits Uttarakhand's Chamoli; Shops, Vehicles Damaged
Curated By :

News18.com
Last Updated:

Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Saturday said in a post on X that he is constant touch with the local administration.
Aftermath of Chamoli cloudburst

One person is feared dead and several are missing after a cloudburst incident hit UttarakhandтАЩs Chamoli on Friday night, leading to widespread damage across multiple locations. The incident has resulted in debris flows affecting local markets, roads, and residential areas.

Heavy debris has entered the Tharali market and surrounding areas of Kotdeep Tehsil, damaging houses and burying several vehicles.

RECOMMENDED STORIES

In Sagwad village, a girl is reported to be trapped under debris inside a collapsed building. Additionally, shops in the Chepardon market have suffered structural damage due to the debris flow.

District Magistrate and relief teams have left for the spot. Two people are reported missing: Uttarakhand Disaster Management Secretary VinodтАж pic.twitter.com/V2aesFekFfтАФ ANI (@ANI) August 23, 2025

Speaking about the incident, Chamoli DM Sandeep Tiwari said,"Last night there was a cloud burst incident in Tharali, causing widespread damage to Tharali and the surrounding areas. A woman has been trapped in the debris of her house, and a man has gone missing. There has been a huge loss of property. Administration and other teams are at the spot, and clearance and rescue work is underwayтАж"

A woman has been trapped in the debris of her house, and a man has gone missing. There has been a hugeтАж pic.twitter.com/pWzaspRkLTтАФ ANI (@ANI) August 23, 2025

Meanwhile, the heavy rainfall and resulting debris have led to road blockages, with the Tharali-Gwaldam road closed at Minggadera and the Tharali-Sagwada road also rendered impassable.

In response, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) team has been dispatched from Gauchar to carry out rescue and relief operations.

Chamoli District Magistrate Sandeep Tiwari has confirmed the situation and stated that teams are actively working at the affected sites. Efforts are ongoing to assess the full extent of the damage and ensure the safety of local residents.

title: Another cloudburst hits Uttarakhand: 1 feared dead, widespread damage reported in Chamoli - MSN
article_text:
A cloudburst struck UttarakhandтАЩs Chamoli district late Friday night, unleashing heavy debris flow that caused widespread destruction. Tharali market, Kotdeep, and the Tharali tehsil complex were among the worst-hit areas, with mud and rubble sweeping into homes, the SDM residence, and several buildings.
Vehicles parked at the tehsil complex were buried, while streets turned into pools of water and debris. In Sagwara village, a young girl is feared dead after being trapped under the rubble, triggering panic among locals who rushed out of their homes as rescue operations got underway.
Shops in Chepdaon market also suffered damage, and one person has been reported missing, adding to the crisis.
Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed concern, saying he is in constant touch with officials monitoring relief efforts. In a post on X, he wrote, тАЬLate last night, a tragic report of a cloudburst was received in the Tharali area of Chamoli district. The district administration, SDRF, and police have reached the spot and are engaged in relief and rescue operations. In this regard, I am in constant contact with the local administration and am personally closely monitoring the situation. I pray to God for everyone's safety.тАЭ

title: Uttarakhand: Cloudburst in Tharali wreaks havoc, rescue ops on - News9live
article_text:
New Delhi: A cloudburst struck Tharali in Chamoli district, Uttarakhand, causing significant damage and leaving two people missing. Heavy rainfall triggered flash floods, sweeping debris into homes, businesses, and even the SDMтАЩs residence. News reports indicate that rescue operations are underway, with the District Magistrate and relief teams already deployed to the affected area. Search operations are ongoing to locate the two missing individuals. The extent of the damage is still being assessed.
In response to the incident, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami stated that he is closely monitoring the situation. Teams from the district administration, State Disaster Response Force (SDRF), and police are on-site conducting relief operations.
Nearly two feet of debris has accumulated in the tehsil premises, including Chepado Bazar and Kotdweep Bazar, and several residential areas. This has also buried some vehicles after the Tunri Gadera stream overflowed. A significant portion of Dharali village has been devastated by flash floods.
An orange alert is currently in effect in Uttarakhand, as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicts thunderstorms, lightning, and very heavy rainfall in various areas of the state.

title: Telangana reels under dry spell, IMD forecasts thunderstorms - The New Indian Express
article_text:
HYDERABAD: Telangana witnessed dry weather across all districts on Friday, with no significant rainfall reported, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Despite the prevailing conditions, the IMD has issued a yellow alert for thunderstorms with lightning in several districts over the next 24 hours.
The alert indicates possible moderate rain and thunder activity in isolated places, though most regions are expected to stay dry. Meteorologists noted that while monsoon activity has weakened in recent days, sporadic showers cannot be ruled out due to local weather systems.
